int32_t gaia::text::DigitsKeyListener::getInputType ( ) [virtual]

Return the type of text that this key listener is manipulating, as per InputType.

This is used to determine the mode of the soft keyboard that is shown for the editor.

If you return InputType#TYPE_NULL then no soft keyboard will provided. In other words, you must be providing your own key pad for on-screen input and the key

listener will be used to handle input from a hard keyboard.

If you return any other value, a soft input method will be created when the user puts focus in the editor, which will provide a keypad and also

consume hard key events. This means that the key listener will generally not be used, instead the soft input method will take care of managing key input as per the content type returned here.

Implements gaia::text::KeyListener.

static DigitsKeyListener* gaia::text::DigitsKeyListener::getInstance ( bool  sign,
bool  decimal 
) [static]

Returns a DigitsKeyListener that accepts the digits 0 through 9, plus the minus sign (only at the beginning) and/or decimal point (only one per field) if specified.
